answerBox.snippet: Value is the lightness or darkness of a color, and it adds dimension in a piece. Value is also a concept in color, as mentioned above. Artists can create value in line drawings through different shading techniques which use different types of line.
snippetHighlighted: the lightness or darkness of a color

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the value of art quizlet?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Value is the lightness or darkness of an object. The amount of light a color reflects determines its value. Remember that value also possesses an emotional quality. Dark values can add mystery, gloominess, and sadness to an artwork, while white or light values can create an easy, peaceful, bright feeling.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Elements of Art - Value Flashcards - Quizlet

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the purpose and value of art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art can uplift, provoke, soothe, entertain and educate us and is an important part of our lives. At its most profound level, it takes us from the everyday to a place of introspection and contemplation, to see the bigger picture of the human condition.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What Is The Purpose of Art? - Peninsula Arts Society

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do we see value?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Value is how light or dark a color is. White holds the lightest value, and black is the darkest value. Our eyes see first in light and dark, and see color second. The secret to creating dynamic, wow-worthy artwork is to focus on the value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to See Value - Shelby Dillon Studio
